output.dependency: The value in the title column suggests the work of a particular writer or director. Therefore, the title of the film (e.g., 'In Dubious Battle') is dependent on the name of the writer or director associated with it (e.g., 'James Franco').
The year of release (e.g., '2016') indicates the geographical context of the film's release (e.g., '2016 (USA)'), suggesting that the emission year defines the region of release.

The list of actors (column describing main cast) directly influences the more comprehensive list of actors for the film (column detailing full cast), indicating that the lead actors are part of the entire cast.
The specification of language (e.g., 'English') generally implies the country of origin or primary market (e.g., 'USA'). Hence, language shares a semantic dependency on the country.

The genre of the film (e.g., 'Drama') typically reflects the overarching theme or narrative style of the storyline (e.g., description of the plot). Thus, the genre is semantically linked to the plot description.
